into.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to the inside or inner part of a container, place, area etc
into.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: He thrust his hand into his coat pocket.
There must be another way into the cave.
Sue got back into bed and pulled the quilt over her head.
I’ve got to go into town this morning.
into.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: used to say that someone becomes involved in a situation or activity, or becomes part of a group
into.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: At the age of 16, I went into the printing trade as an apprentice.
They tried to drag me into their quarrel.
a player who deserves to get back into the England team
into.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: used to say that someone or something starts being in a different state or form
into.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: She fell into a deep sleep.
The whole banking system was thrown into confusion.
I screwed my wet handkerchief into a ball.
Neruda’s poems have been translated into English.
into.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: used to say that a person or vehicle hits someone or something after moving towards them
into.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: He almost bumped into me as he rushed past.
The car swerved and crashed into the wall.
into.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: They rode off into the sunset.
Make sure you’re speaking directly into the microphone.
into.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: at or until a certain time
into.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: Andy and I talked well into the night.
John was well into his forties before he got married.
into.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: used to say what someone is trying to find out information about
into.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: an investigation into the events leading up to his death
I’ve been doing some research into this.
into.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: used when you are dividing one number by another
